title: K-Means Machine Learning
description: K Means Clustering is a mathematical algorithm for reducing a set of information by creating a cluster of observed values based on the nears mean. The is also called "vector quantization". A classical use case for this would be to reduce the number of colors in a photo to a smaller color pallete for image compression.
when_to_use: When lossy compression or pattern recognition is desired. Reducing images sizes for analysis, or taking natural language strings and identifying the root concepts. Often used in combination with other techniques

title: A-Priori Machine Learning
description: Generally used for text mining over transactional databases to highlight data trends in the data.
when_not_to_use: Generally not used now? Replaced by Max-Miner

title: ETL
description: ETL stands for Extract, Transform, Load. These are tools used to take multiple data inputs, transform and harmonize the data on common measures and load them to a data warehouse.
when_not_to_use: You don't require a scaled solution

title: Structured vs Unstructured Data
description: Overview of terminology of structured and unstructured data in database

title: Statistical  Modeling
description: Introduction to basic statistical ideas, techniques and SPSS statistical package

title: Feature Engineering
description: “Feature engineering is the process of using domain knowledge of the data to create features that make machine learning algorithms work. Feature engineering is fundamental to the application of machine learning, and is both difficult and expensive. The need for manual feature engineering can be obviated by automated feature learning.”

title: Ensemble Algorithms / Learning
description: Ensemble methods are techniques that create multiple models and then combine them to produce improved results. Ensemble methods usually produce more accurate solutions than a single model would.

title: Distributed ETL
description: This tool can work huge amounts of data in parallel, processes and loads into any Data store. This can be developed by using Spark or Python.
